text: In geo-speak, does roundingprecision mean number of decimal digits or significant digits?

elements.text: In geo-speak, does roundingprecision mean number of decimal digits or significant digits?

text: It seems that it means number of decimal digits based on <https://simple.wikipedia.org/wiki/Precision_(numbers)>

elements.text: It seems that it means number of decimal digits based on

text:
If I use `setPrecision` to set the grid size, writer writes significant digits
```using LibGEOS
p = readgeom("POINT (654321.12345 0.12345)");
p0 = setPrecision(p, 0);
writegeom(p0)```
gives
```"POINT (654321.12345 0.12345)"```
but
```p2 = setPrecision(p, 0.02);
writegeom(p2)```
gives
```"POINT (6.5e+05 0.12)"```
I think the code is in
<https://github.com/libgeos/geos/blob/master/src/io/WKTWriter.cpp#L176-L184>
This is with GEOS_jll 3.9.0.  I think I file this as an issue first to LibGEOS.jl.

text: Huh strange, so `getMaximumSignificantDigits` from your link returns something like 2? That 6.5e+05 is awfully imprecise.

elements.text: from your link returns something like 2? That 6.5e+05 is awfully imprecise.

text: Hmm, this is visible due to the writer changes to LibGEOS v0.6.6.

elements.text: Hmm, this is visible due to the writer changes to LibGEOS v0.6.6.

text: Yeah indeed. I assumed our default precision of -1 would not lead to such loss of information.

elements.text: Yeah indeed. I assumed our default precision of -1 would not lead to such loss of information.
